resources.string: This is a small widget utility to show the data plan usage with a \'constant\' usage bar. Useful to know if you are above or below the \'constant\' data usage (if you consume the same data every second). \nApp created by TrianguloY (email)

Widget description: 
- The upper bar is the optimal continuous usage: 0 at the start of the period, half at the middle of the period, full at the end. 
- The bottom bar is your current usage. If the bottom bar is less than the upper bar then at that rate you will have data unused. If it is more then you will probably surpass it. 
- Click the right button of the widget to open the history list, click the text to show the corresponding day of the current usage, click anywhere else to manually update it (it updates automatically).
This is just a preview. Add the real widget to your home screen!

This screen shows the usage on each day of the period related to the average one.

A bar to the right means the usage was greater than the average, a bar to the left means the opposite.

Use the buttons to change the period.
READ_PHONE_STATE:\nPermission needed to get the device identificator. No other data is retrieved nor used. Click the button below to give the permission if necessary.

PACKAGE_USAGE_STATS:\nPermission needed to get the current usage from the usage service. No other data is retrieved nor used. If required click the button below, select this app and enable the permission.
Total data:\nusage to show in the upper bar when totally filled. Normally your data plan limit. In megabytes (MB)
First day of period:\nWhen to start counting usage (day of month)
Decimals:\nNumber of decimals that data numbers will display.
Display data in GB instead of MB.
Alternate conversion:\nCheck this if data usage shown is always less than real usage returned by your company app. [Technical details: uses 1000 instead of 1024 to convert from bytes to megabytes]

Accumulate from previous months:\nNumber of months that unused data is saved to future periods. If zero, unused data is lost when changing period. If not, the unused megas from the previous n months will be spent before the current ones (will show a \'negative\' usage until then).

This parameter will automatically try to update each period, but if you are enabling this for the first time you must enter manually the accumulated megas from the previous period (check your data provider). Alternatively you can press the button for an automatic computation (better check it afterwards). You can edit it at any time.
Your current usage correspond to date:\n%s\n(%s)

List of experimental settings to tweak some properties of widgets (may be added/removed in future versions if necessary). Some combinations may not work together or show unwanted results (like \'hide date\'+\'hide data\' which will show an empty widget) but they are safe to enable/disable so have fun tweaking as you want.\n\nImportant! Existing widgets may need to be clicked or removed/added to update.

Hide data bar and text (the bottom one)
Show light-theme widgets (white background with black text)
Show the consumed data in the 1x1 widget (instead of the rate)
Show the average data in the 1x1 widget (instead of the rate)
Show remaining data instead of consumed data (bars will move from 100% to 0% instead of 0% to 100%)
Keep bar at 100% instead of warping (in case your device don\'t show the secondary bar)
